name: Drawing I
description: Drawing 1 introduces core drawing practices at the entry level. This course provides an opportunity for students to develop their drawing skills, visual vocabulary, and understanding of conceptual and formal approaches to both historical and contemporary practices. Drawing is presented as a technical, interpretive, and expressive tool: students make observational drawings from objects, environments, and the figure, and work with imagined and found sources. Sessions include demonstrations, illustrated presentations, and individual assignments. [72P]
